Pre-Game Insights: India begin strongly the chase as Rohit and Shubman begin in attacking mode
Bangladesh won the toss and elected to bat first
India have a 3-1 record against Bangladesh in World Cups
In the last four ODIs played between the two teams, Bangladesh have beaten India thrice
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rohit Sharma scored 48 before being caught
Shubman Gill reached his 10th ODI fifty
Others: India need 257 runs to win the match
Kuldeep Yadav, Ravindra Jadeja, Mohammed Siraj, Shardul Thakur, and Jasprit Bumrah were the Indian bowlers who took wickets
